Object Generators#

Basic Nucleus Generator#

class src.blender.Object.NucleusGenerator_basic.CoreGenerator#

Bases: object

Class responsible for generating core objects.

create(obj_name, subdiv, radius)#

Create a new icosphere object in Blender and assign it to the CoreGenerator. Multiple of these objects can with the core_merger function be merged into one nucleus.

Parameters:

  • obj_name (str) – The name of the icosphere object.

  • subdiv (int) – The number of subdivisions for the icosphere.

  • radius (float) – The radius of the icosphere.

rotate(rotation)#

Rotate the icosphere object.

Parameters:

rotation (list[float]) – The rotation angles (in degrees) around the X, Y, and Z axes.

scale(scale)#

Scale the icosphere object.

Parameters:

scale (list [float]) – The scale factors for each axis (x, y, z).

shape(transform)#

Function to transform the object into any ellipsoid out of a sphere.

Parameters:

transform (list[float]) – The scale of each axis into which the object should be stretched. “transform” is a list of three values for x,y,z axis.

translate(location)#

Translate the icosphere object.

Parameters:

location (list [float]) – The translation vector (x, y, z).

class src.blender.Object.NucleusGenerator_basic.NucleusGenerator#

Bases: object

Class responsible for generating nucleus objects out of multiple cores, merging them and modifing them to make them look like a comet

core_generators#

Initialize the NucleusGenerator. Json file needs to have the cores first in the file from top to bottom. Addons cannot be reused for multiple cores It creates cores from a json file and performs adaptations on it. Noise verticles for object creation before remesh, not bigger than 0.7 noise verticles after merge smaller 0.5 noise displacing one: strenght below 0.7 and size smaller than 2 Noise displacement two: strenght below 0.3 and size below 0.7

core_merger(core, addon)#

Merges the core with an according addon :param core: the object the addon shall be added to :type core: bpy.types.object :param addon: the object which is added to the core :type addon: bpy.types.object

create_and_merge_cores_from_json(core_config)#

Create and merge cores based on data from the dictionary taken from the json file.

This function reads data from a dictionary containing information about the cores and merge operations. It creates core objects with specified parameters, performs transformations on the cores, merges the cores together, and returns a dictionary of the created core objects.

Parameters:

json_file (str) – Path to the JSON file containing core and merge data.

Returns:

Dictionary containing the core objects with their names as keys.

Return type:

dict

create_core(core_name, subdiv, radius)#

Create a new core using CoreGenerator and store it in the core_generators dictionary.

Parameters:

  • core_name (str) – The name the core shall have.

  • subdiv (int) – The number of subdivisions for the core.

  • radius (float) – The radius of the core.

get_core(core_name)#

Get a specific core from the core_generators dictionary.

Parameters:

core_name (str) – The name of the core to retrieve.

Returns:

The CoreGenerator object representing the core, or None if not found.

Return type:

bpy.types.object

object_cleaner(removable_object)#

Cleans the project of a specified object. Usually applied after merging was performed :param removable_object: The object to be removed :type removable_object: bpy.types.Object

project_cleaner()#

Cleans the project of unused textures to avoid that the project file gets too big

class src.blender.Object.NucleusGenerator_basic.Nucleus_modulator#

Bases: object

Class which provides all functionalities needed to adapt the comet as needed. NOTE:Some of these functions can perform fairly detailed shape adaptations, however, they might be overwritten by a texture displacement

apply_modifier()#

Applies created modifier. It has to performed at certain steps to avoid interference between the different modifiers

Parameters:

modifier_name (str) – Apply the given modifier according to the specified name

mod_add_subdivision(levels, render_levels)#

Add a subdivision modifier to the target object.

Parameters:

  • target_object (bpy.types.Object) – The object to add the subdivision modifier to.

  • levels (int) – The number of subdivision levels in the viewport.

  • render_levels (int) – The number of subdivision levels in the final render.

mod_noise_displace(strength, noise_scale)#

Add a noise displace modifier to the target object.

Parameters:

  • target_object (bpy.types.Object) – The object to add the noise displace modifier to.

  • strength (float) – The strength of the displace effect.

  • noise_scale (float) – The scale of the noise texture.

mod_remesh_sharp(remesh_param)#

Remeshes the mesh with the sharp sessing. Mostly used after merging to objects to get the mesh equally distributed

Parameters:

  • target_object (bpy.types.Object) – the object given to the function where the remesh shall be applied to

  • octree_depth (int) – The depth of the octree used for remeshing. Higher values result in finer details.

  • scale (float) – The scaling factor for the remeshing operation. Values between 0.1 and 1.0 are recommended.

  • sharpness (float) – Higher values produce sharper edges.

mod_remesh_voxel(voxel_size, shade)#

Remeshes the mesh. Mostly used after merging to objects

Parameters:

  • target_object (bpy.types.Object) – the object given to the function where the remesh shall be applied to

  • voxel_size (float) – The voxel size for the remesh

  • shade (Boolean) – Defines the shading mode True = Smooth, False = Flat

noise_vertices(noise_intensity)#

This adapts the verticles of the object randomly. The result is random but depends on the amount of subdivisions and the noise intensity

Parameters:

  • target_object (bpy.types.Object) – the object given to the function where the noise shall be applied to

  • noise_intensity (int) – The intensity of the noise to be applied

set_smooth()#

Sets the object visuals to smooth

Parameters:

smooth (boolean) – True for smooth, False for flat shade (not smooth)

class src.blender.Object.NucleusGenerator_basic.TextureHandler#

Bases: object

Controls and configures the textures in the project

material_displacement(intensity)#

Adapts the displacement properties of the material. The bigger the comet is the higher the value has to be. If the comet looks too smooth and is missing an asteroid “roughness”, then the intensity is likely too low. If the comet looks very rough and exagerated shape, then the intensity is likely too high.

Parameters:

  • material (str) – The name of the material which should be used

  • target_object (bpy.types.Object) – The object the texture should be applied to

material_link(target_object)#

Links the given texture to the target object. :param target_object: The object the texture should be applied to :type target_object: bpy.types.Object
